column5: Absolutely. I think about it everyday, and it (almost literally) drives me crazy. I just want to be at peace...that‚Äôs my only goal.
My family. Without them, I would‚Äôve been dead a long time ago.
It‚Äôs nice not to worry about hangovers, self-disgust, and feeling like shit. That‚Äôs all I know. Right now, sobriety is like my new high. Hopefully it continues.

Thank you
Thank you

You sound ‚Äúnormal‚Äù to me. The things you are feeling are totally understandable (and relatively common).

I also struggle with feelings of alienation. Very strong feelings...I know it‚Äôs hard. But just be you. Inner peace is where it‚Äôs at. If you have that, you have everything.

As someone who‚Äôs dealt with feelings of self-hatred for years, I totally relate. But you deserve happiness just as much as anyone else. I‚Äôm sure you haven‚Äôt done anything that bad...you‚Äôre not a bad person, just a tortured one...like me and many others. Hope you find peace.

There‚Äôs nothing wrong with you. It might feel like there is, but that‚Äôs just your mind playing tricks on you. Everything you‚Äôre feeling is completely normal. 

The human mind is a complex thing...which is a blessing and a curse, I guess. Hope things get better for you very soon.

I ask myself the same question all the time. I‚Äôve never really been close to anyone either...Self-acceptance is the key, but that can be really hard. I hope you find peace.

I totally understand what you‚Äôre going through. I‚Äôm living it myself...you‚Äôre not alone.
I know exactly how you feel. It‚Äôs hell. But you deserve happiness. I hope you find peace soon.

If you‚Äôre at all worried, it‚Äôs better to be safe than sorry. Doing it under medical supervision might be the right move. They should make the process relatively comfortable for you. I wish you all the best with everything.
Lmao, same. In a heartbeat.
It‚Äôs depressing. Is this really what our country has come to? I hope there‚Äôs a backlash, and our next president is the exact opposite of Trump.

The problem is, I like being alone too much. On a scale of 1-10 for introversion, I‚Äôm like a 20. It‚Äôs kind of ridiculous.
I loved it in the beginning. It was a quick fix, and it was fun too...which is exactly what I was looking for. But it got kind of bad eventually.
For me, being alone is peaceful...I didn‚Äôt used to look at it that way, but I do now. I enjoy my own company. I don‚Äôt need anyone else.
Drugs/alcohol
The urge to self-medicate can be difficult to resist...I know that from personal experience. But you have to be careful. If it gets out hand, it‚Äôll just make everything worse.

Robinson

People (not all, but many) don‚Äôt care about *you*, they care about what you can *do*, your productivity, and how well you fit in as a cog in the machine. That‚Äôs how I see society. But that‚Äôs just me...

To make a long story short, I need direction in my life...some kind of purpose for my future. I‚Äôm just too weak and scared to take the necessary steps to make anything happen. I‚Äôve grown comfortable with being aimless. And I hate myself for it.
